bibl.title: Letter from [S.C. Mead] to Merritte W. Ireland, June 20, 1922

div1.p: [Mead] writes to Surgeon-General Ireland in support of the continuation of Mabel Lazear's annuity.

div1.head: Letter from [S.C. Mead] to Merritte W. Ireland, June 20, 1922
div1.opener:
COPY
June 20, 1922.
Major General M.W. Ireland, U.S.A.,
Surgeon-General of the United States,
War Department,
Washington, D.C.
Dear Major General Ireland:
div1.p:
The writer recalls with much pleasure his contact with
you in 1907 and 1908 with respect to the effort to secure fitting
recognition of the services of Doctor Jesse W. Lazear and Major
James Carroll, as members of the Yellow Fever Commission, through
the granting of an annuity for the proper support of the widow
and children of each of those officers.

We are accordingly taking the liberty of enclosing
herein carbon copy of a letter sent today to Hon. Daniel R.
Anthony, Jr., Chairman of the Subcommittee of the Committee on
Appropriations, House of Representatives, Washington, D.C., urg-
ing the continuance of that annuity. The letter has been for-
warded in the belief that consideration is now being given to
the continuation of the annuity by said subcommittee in connection
with the provisions of the War Department Appropriation Bill.

The marked interest which you personally manifested
in appropriate recognition of the eminent service of Doctor
Lazear and Major Carroll, in the manner mentioned, prompts us
to address you at this time in the earnest hope that you may
now reiterate that interest by favorable formal recommendation,
if present circumstances permit you consistently so to do.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, THE MERCHANTS' ASSOCIATION OF NEW YORK.
BY
Secretary. SCM:AD
